meanings.definition: The first offspring of an animal.
meanings.sent1: The farmer proudly showed off the firstlings of his sheep.
meanings.sent2: The firstlings of the cow were healthy and energetic.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy played with the firstlings of the litter.
meanings.sent4: The firstlings of the flock were like a ray of sunshine in the barn.
meanings.sent5: The children were excited to see the firstlings of the newborn lambs.

meanings.definition: The first fruits or products of something.
meanings.sent1: The baker used the firstlings of the wheat harvest to make fresh bread.
meanings.sent2: The firstlings of the apple tree were ripe and ready to be picked.
meanings.sent3: The chef prepared a delicious dish using the firstlings of the garden vegetables.
meanings.sent4: The firstlings of the vineyard produced a sweet and flavorful wine.
meanings.sent5: The community eagerly awaited the firstlings of the annual harvest festival.

meanings.definition: The earliest or most important examples of something.
meanings.sent1: In literature class, we studied the firstlings of English poetry.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed the firstlings of ancient artifacts found in the region.
meanings.sent3: The teacher highlighted the firstlings of scientific discoveries in the lesson.
meanings.sent4: The artist's studio showcased the firstlings of his creative masterpieces.
meanings.sent5: The library preserved the firstlings of historical documents for future generations.
